alert.note: Alert for North Laramie Range; Shirley Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 3:50PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Albany County through 415 PM MDT... At 350 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles west of Garrett, or 47 miles west of Wheatland, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laramie Peak, Friend Park Campground and Garrett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
